place.name: BURLINGHAM ST EDMUND
place.gazetteerText: BURLINGHAM-ST. EDMUND, a parish in Blofield district, Norfolk; contiguous to Burlingham-St. Andrew. Post Town, Burlingham, under Norwich. Acres, 661. Real property, £1,820. Pop., 85. Houses, 17. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory, annexed to the rectory of Burlingham-St. Andrew, in the diocese of Norwich. The church is old but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
